marketplaces.name: gstoehl-marketplace
marketplaces.description: Personal Claude Code plugins: local tools, workflows, and custom skills

files.README.md:
# GStoehL Claude Code Marketplace

Personal plugin marketplace for Claude Code containing custom tools and workflows.

## Available Plugins

### gstoehl-tools
Local CLI tools integration including:
- `km` - Knowledge management (Zettelkasten notes)
- `bookmark` - URL bookmark manager with semantic search
- `shot-scraper` - Automated website screenshot tool built on Playwright
- Paperless-ngx document management workflows

## Installation

### Option 1: Via URL (Recommended for testing)

```bash
# Add marketplace via URL
claude-code plugins add-marketplace https://raw.githubusercontent.com/USERNAME/gstoehl-marketplace/main/.claude-plugin/marketplace.json

# Install plugin from marketplace
claude-code plugins install gstoehl-marketplace:gstoehl-tools
```

### Option 2: Via GitHub

```bash
# Add marketplace from GitHub repo
claude-code plugins add-marketplace github:USERNAME/gstoehl-marketplace

# Install plugin
claude-code plugins install gstoehl-marketplace:gstoehl-tools
```

### Option 3: Local Development

```bash
# For local testing, symlink to Claude's plugins directory
ln -s ~/gstoehl-marketplace ~/.claude/plugins/marketplaces/gstoehl-marketplace

# Then manually add to known_marketplaces.json
```

## Plugin Structure

```
gstoehl-marketplace/
├── .claude-plugin/
│   └── marketplace.json          # Marketplace manifest
├── README.md                      # This file
└── .git/                          # Git repository
```

Each plugin referenced in marketplace.json should have:
```
plugin-name/
├── .claude-plugin/
│   └── plugin.json               # Plugin manifest
├── skills/                       # Skills directory
│   └── skill-name/
│       └── SKILL.md              # Skill documentation
├── commands/                     # Slash commands (optional)
├── agents/                       # Subagent configs (optional)
└── README.md                     # Plugin documentation
```

## Creating Your Own Plugins

1. Create a new repository for your plugin
2. Add `.claude-plugin/plugin.json` with metadata
3. Add your skills, commands, or agents
4. Reference it in this marketplace's `marketplace.json`
5. Push changes and update marketplace URL

## License

MIT
